title: @Meddler @Riot @WHO EVER THE HELL I NEED TO YELL AND VENT AT.
body:
So i read about the Kog rework again. (or unrework i should say?)

Now i see you talk about Morde and how it missed the mark and all and yeah your damn right you did.

So I'm asking why is it Kogmaw gets to be a special snowflake and get fixed before Morde? You all fucked him up before Kog so why is he getting the back sit?

Ill be real i'm so honestly pissed off when i saw that post and trying my BEST not to go full rage on here and just endless rant but seriously this just feels like double standards.


idk maybe i just needed to vent w.e



-pissed off Hue main.

maybe because they don't want AP kog to come back?

seriously some champions just weren't meant to go certain build paths even if they have some small synergy with it. Imagine if Pantheon was made all AD and then just shake your head in disbelief when you hear someone complain about AP Pantheon being ruined.

But AP Kog Maw had a very legit playstyle, build path, and player base. He became a very potent high range poke threat, especially with items. If you played him well, he was one of the ultimate ap poke champs because his ult gave him insane range. 

Comparing Pantheon who as one AP scaling on his w to AP Kog doesn't make sense.
He also has AP scaling on his ultimate the very thing you are saying that made AP kog maw "good"

It's not just about whether the spells have AP ratios attached to it (sorry about missing panth's ult). It's also about what do those spells do, can AP items enhance the spells, can AP items enhance the playstyle of the champ? In Kogmaw's case: absolutely (Seraph for mana galore and a clutch shield, rylai's for sick ult chaining, etc). 

In Panth's case......

I heard the argument being made before for AP Pantheons burst from his ultimate and W. There are definitely items that can allow that play style. Is it actually practical though? No since it needs too many things to work. Same could be said about AP kog Maw.

No there are no items, because everyone can see his giant ult indicator, so there's that AP damage right out the window. And his W (while having 100% AP scaling) is very low range and decently cd, while also putting him in range of everything (which if he's building full AP means he just jumped into suicide)

AP Kog used to have a spammable high damaging (base damage with decent scaling), super long range ult. Coupled with a long range high damaging E, he had a very potent niche of being the longest ranged poke mid. And with his very spammable ult with rylais you could chain a lot of damage from an obscene range (URF mode was just too fun).

In any regard: Kog Maw's kit allowed for him to have a practical AP build (Or at least high mana and magic penetration AP items) because of the way the spells worked. Pantheon's kit does not.

First to be clear I'm not defending AP pantheon cause I think its good or viable. If anything I would highly discourage it but I'm playing devils advocate. Pantheon theoretically benefits from AP and magic penetration just like Kog Maw. Just because someone sees his ultimate doesn't mean they can dodge in time or he can just sit in bushes to ambush people with his W. He also has the highest base move speed to chase people down. He already hits people with his W as AD so its just as possible as AP. Also for a "practical" build he doesn't get the ability he relies on the most until 6, seems very practical to me.

......... wut

He hits people with his W as AD, because it lets him proc his AD E, which is massive damage. His W is solely used for the utility. And his high base move speed does nothing if he does no damage because it's all frontloaded into one higher CD AP spell. And he doesn't rely on 6 for his AD build, it just allows to snowball the other lanes after he's snowballed his lane.

Honestly, you trying to even argue that AP Pantheon is even some kind of viable in order to say AP Kog wasn't is just silly. At least use a different example, because you're arguments for AP panth are insane.

This exactly.

People often demand a reversion of Mordekaiser to his previous state, expecting that somehow balance and fairness would come along with the kit that he had pre-rework. But that was never the case, and Mordekaiser sat in a proverbial twilight zone of being so oppressively toxic to face for anyone who didn't have the tools to counter him that Riot could not give him any meaningful buffs.

You think Yasuo is annoying with all his tricks? I wonder if and when the Yasuo circlejerk could have ever handled someone who can burst your ass into nonexistence AND take hits just as well periodically BECAUSE of how much he melts your face, and this is also someone who can take the most fed person on your team and turn him into HIS team's biggest ally should said person make a catastrophic failure.

Feast or famine, thy name is Mordekaiser.

A rework was always in his destiny, it just so happened we got one that nobody was happy with at some point.

I'm pretty sure we would be happy with a partial reversion of Mordekaiser, get to keep a few of the goodies from his rework (the dragon ghost, the shield now scaling with health, maybe the Q and maybe the heal from his W when it expires), of course numbers and costs would need to be changed if we got a partial reversion.

But please, everyone, don't act like reverting Mordekaiser would solve all his problems. Return him to a playstyle more people enjoy, very likely, but solve all his balance problems? Either you are smoking something seriously strong or you never actually played as or against Mordekaiser pre-rework and are just jumping on the bandwagon.

You just made the case for old malzahar..... Malzahar was very weak to ganks and strong engages, but he had excellent damage for a teamfight if positioned properly, and a great 1v1. His new passive broke him, because the passive itself is either broken OP, or nerfed so much its borderline useless (its state right now). And now that his passive is not very good, he plays even less aggressively than he ever has. On top of this, most of his damage was front-lined into his gimmicky w, which is so easy to negate if you know what you're doing (aka, kill the voidlings). 

And Malz was only faceroll burst if you were dumb enough to either: get in his close range, or let him walk right up to you. Most of what malzahar actually did in teamfights (contrary to everyone thinking he just flashed r'ed people all the time) was sit back and try and get E bounces, and Q damage and play a more poke-kite style. 

All in all: old malz had very great strengths and very great weaknesses. New malz is totally based on his passive which can either make or break him.
